meanings.definition: A figure or model of a human being used to display clothes.
meanings.sent1: The store used mannequins to show off their latest fashion.
meanings.sent2: The mannequins in the window displayed the new collection beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The mannequins decided to have a fashion show of their own after hours.
meanings.sent4: She stood as still as a mannequin, showcasing elegance and grace.
meanings.sent5: The mannequins seemed to come to life as the spotlight shone on them.

meanings.definition: A person who is very thin and has no curves.
meanings.sent1: She was often called a mannequin because of her slender figure.
meanings.sent2: The fashion industry sometimes promotes unrealistic body standards by idealizing mannequin-like figures.
meanings.sent3: At the buffet, he joked that he felt like a mannequin among all the food lovers.
meanings.sent4: Her silhouette in the moonlight resembled that of a mannequin, tall and straight.
meanings.sent5: The mannequin-like model walked down the runway with an air of confidence.
